name: Dipti Koirala
label: B.Sc., Electrical Engineering (2025)
description: Dipti Koirala is currently an undergraduate student in the Electrical Engineering program at Texas State University, concentrating in Micro and Nano Devices and Systems. She joined the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) Lab in Summer 2025 and is an undergraduate research assistant under the supervision of Dr. Subasish Das. Dipti is keenly interested in the intersection of electronics, semiconductors, data science, and intelligent transportation systems. Her academic interests include sensor-driven technologies, signal processing, and the use of AI to improve traffic safety and infrastructure performance. With a background in physics-based research, materials analysis, and applied mathematics, she brings a multidisciplinary perspective to the lab and is passionate about contributing to innovative, data-informed solutions engineering fields.

name: Mahmuda Sultana Mimi
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (2023 - 2025)
description: Mahmuda is currently pursuing Master's in Civil Engineering at Texas State University under the supervision of Dr. Subasish Das. She joined AIT lab in Fall 2023 as a Graduate Research Assistant. Previously, she earned her Bachelor's degree in Urban and Regional Planning from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET). Her research focuses on transportation safety, encompassing vulnerable road users, driver behavior, and micromobility; as well as travel behavior and demand modeling. She is deeply engaged in developing Machine Learning, and Deep Learning based models; Statistical and Econometric models; GIS based spatial data analysis; and data mining in the field of transportation. In addition to her academic pursuits, she serves as the secretary of the ITE TXST chapter, where she supports initiatives to enhance transportation systems and promote safety.

name: Syed Aaqib Javed
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (2023 – 2025)
description: Syed Aaqib Javed is a Master's student in Civil Engineering, specializing in Transportation Engineering at Texas State University (TXST). He has been working as a graduate research assistant at the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) Lab under the supervision of Dr. Subasish Das since Fall 2023. Prior to joining TXST, he worked as a faculty member at Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology (AUST) in Dhaka, Bangladesh. He completed his B.Sc. in Civil Engineering at AUST. His research interests include transportation safety, transportation system planning, and travel behavior analysis. In addition to his academic work, he is an active member of the TXST-ITE student chapter, where he contributes to projects aimed at optimizing transportation infrastructure and promoting safety initiatives.

name: Swastika Barua
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (2023 - 2025)
description: Swastika Barua is pursuing her Master's in Civil Engineering at Texas State University, under the supervision of Dr. Subasish Das. She joined the AIT Lab in Fall 2023 and currently working as a Graduate Research Assistant. Swastika obtained her Bachelor's degree from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Bangladesh. Her research focuses on traffic safety and driver behavior analysis, with a specialization in classical statistical methods and machine learning techniques. Beyond her academic endeavors, Swastika actively participates in the TXST-ITE student chapter, contributing to initiatives aimed at enhancing transportation systems and safety.
awards: Scholarly Travel Activity and Research (S.T.A.R.) Grant, $450 (2024)

name: Jinli Liu, Ph.D.
label: Post-doctoral Researcher (Jan 2025-Current), Ph.D. Student (2023-2024)
description: Jinli Liu is a Ph.D. Candidate in the Geographic Information Science Program in the Department of Geography & Environmental Studies at Texas State University, under the supervision of Dr. Das. She joined the AIT Lab in Fall 2022 and worked as a Doctoral Research Assistant. She holds an M.S. in Transportation Management & Planning from Texas Southern University (2021) and a bachelor's degree, along with an additional master's degree, from Zhejiang Normal University in China. Jinli's research focuses on traffic safety analysis, GIS-based data conflation, spatial analysis, traffic signal design, operational analysis, and the integration of machine learning in transportation studies.
awards: The Bernard W. Detlefsen Doctoral Candidate Scholarship, $1,000 (2024)

name: Ahmed Hossain, Ph.D.
label: Post-Doctoral Researcher (2024 - 2025)
description: Ahmed Hossain is a transportation safety specialist with a deep focus on analyzing crash data to minimize traffic-related incidents and improve road safety. His expertise spans both classical statistical methods and cutting-edge techniques, such as machine learning and hybrid approaches, to identify and model crash patterns. He holds a Ph.D. in Systems Engineering with a concentration in Civil Engineering from the University of Louisiana at Lafayette, as well as a Master’s degree from the same institution, and an undergraduate degree in Civil Engineering from Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology, Bangladesh. Currently, Ahmed serves as a Traffic Safety Officer at the Arizona Department of Transportation (ADOT). Previously, he was as a Post-Doctoral Researcher at the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) Lab in the Civil Engineering Department at Texas State University. Over the years, he has contributed to over 30 peer-reviewed papers and presented his research at major international conferences across the U.S. He has been involved in several projects funded by the Louisiana Transportation Research Center (LTRC), Louisiana Department of Transportation and Development (LaDOTD), National Co-operative Highway Research Program (NCHRP). Ahmed’s research interests are diverse, focusing on improving transportation safety for vulnerable populations such as pedestrians, older adults, and young drivers, as well as safety in high-speed driving environments. His work also extends to exploring the impact of emerging technologies like connected and autonomous vehicles on road safety. As a dedicated researcher, Ahmed is committed to leveraging his multidisciplinary expertise to create data-driven solutions that enhance transportation safety, reduce crash risk, and inform policymaking.

name: Monire Jafari
label: M.Sc., Information Science (2023-2024)
description: Monire Jafari is a skilled Data Analyst with expertise in mathematics, statistics, and data analytics, holding master’s degrees in Mathematics with a concentration in Statistics (2023) and Data Analytics and Information Systems (2024). During her time as a Graduate Research Assistant at the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) Lab at Texas State University, under the mentorship of Dr. Subasish Das, she led various research initiatives and contributed to academic publications. She quickly excelled when working with transportation data, applying her statistical expertise to areas such as choice modeling and advanced machine learning techniques. Monire is proficient in Python, R, SQL, and data visualization tools, and continues to apply her knowledge to solve complex analytical problems.

name: Teale Robison
label: B.Sc., Urban and Regional Planning (2021- 2025)
description: Teale is currently a senior at Texas State University, majoring in Urban and Regional Planning and minoring in Geographic Information Systems (GIS). She started at the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) lab in fall 2024 and is currently working as an undergraduate research assistant for Dr. Das. Teale is passionate about the environment and sustainable development, especially involving transportation and creating a more efficient system. She has prior experience working as a Visual Analytics intern at Texas A&M Transportation Institute (TTI) utilizing GIS and ArcPy. Involved in several campus activities such as the Student Urban Planning Organization (SUPO) and SWIG (Supporting Women in Geography). In her free time, Teale enjoys playing board games, reading, and paddleboarding.
awards: Bernard W. Detlefsen Junior Academic and Leadership Scholarship, $1,500 (2024)

name: Jett Tipsword
label: B.Sc., Computer Science (2023- 2024)
description: Jett Tipsword is a Data Engineer at Leap Metrics, where he uses SQL, Python, and Sigma BI to design and maintain scalable data pipelines, ensuring data accuracy across platforms. He earned a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from Texas State University in December 2023, where he also worked as an AI Researcher, specializing in natural language processing and machine learning with models like BERT, Llama-2, and GPT-2. Jett is also part of the AIT Lab at Texas State University, where he contributed to projects focused on AI and data processing. With expertise in cloud computing, DevOps, and AI integration, he is passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights. Outside of work, Jett enjoys exploring the latest trends in AI.

name: Gian Antariksa, Ph.D.
label: Post-Doctoral Researcher (2023 - 2024)
description: Gian Antariksa, Ph.D. worked as a postdoctoral scholar at AIT Lab at Texas State University, specializes in Industrial Data Science and Engineering, holding a Ph.D. from a joint program between Pukyong National University and Pusan National University in South Korea. With a background that includes an M.Eng in Semiconductor Engineering from Pukyong National University and a B.Sc. in Physics from Diponegoro University, Indonesia, Dr. Antariksa’s research spans across optimizing business processes through big data and interdisciplinary approaches, including geosciences, finances, transportation engineering and semiconductor research. His contributions over six years in industrial intelligence, energy, retail, banking, manufacturing, and healthcare, are documented in numerous prestigious journals, showcasing his commitment to leveraging data science and AI across various sectors. He is current working as a Senior Data Scientist at PT Mitra Solusi Telematika.

name: Md. Nasim Khan, Ph.D.
label: Post-Doctoral Researcher (2022 - 2023)
description: Dr. Nasim Khan is a Senior Transportation Engineer at AtkinsRéalis, specializing in transportation safety, intelligent transportation systems, and traffic engineering. He holds a Ph.D. and a Master of Science in Transportation Engineering from the University of Wyoming, along with a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology. Before his current role, Dr. Khan served as a Postdoctoral Scholar at Texas State University, where he worked at the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) Lab, focusing on crash risk modeling, connected and autonomous vehicles, and smart traffic management systems. His professional experience includes roles as a Postdoctoral Research Associate and Graduate Research Assistant at the University of Wyoming, and as a Lecturer at the University of Information Technology & Sciences. Dr. Khan’s expertise includes advanced traffic control strategies, data-driven safety analysis, and GIS-based transportation studies. He has a strong record of publishing and presenting his research at major conferences and is dedicated to integrating innovative technologies to enhance transportation systems and improve safety.

name: Michael J Starewich
label: M.Sc., Mathematics (2023-2024)
description: Michael Starewich earned his M.S. in Mathematics, with a concentration in Statistics, from Texas State University in December 2024. He has experience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and teaching. Outside of work, he enjoys spending time with his pets and barbecuing on the weekends.
